bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to George C. Kellogg, January 5, 1942

div1.p: Hench arranges for Kellogg to meet Alvarez.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to George C. Kellogg, January 5, 1942

opener.dateline:
January 5, 1942 Mr. George C. Kellogg
257 Cornelison Avenue
Jersey City, N. J.

div1.p:
As I wired you, Dr. Alvarez will be delighted to
cooperate with you. I wasn't sure what gastroenterological
epochyou wanted to memorialize. Alvarez says that most of
the historical gastroenterologists are pictured in his book
“Introduction to Gastroenterology”. He has many photographs
of these bozoa here. If you prefer not to come here he
thinks he could stop in New York City on his way to or from
North Carolina. I suggest you write him at once what you
wish.

Incidentally, I told him about your McDowell paint-
ing. He is much interested in that since he supervised a
diorama of this episode used at the World's Fair and studied
the story, conflicting legends, etc. about it.
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
